item.title: Parameterized xUnit Tests with F#
item.description: This post showcases different ways of writing parameterized tests with xUnit using F#. I’m assuming you have a basic knowledge of F# are familiar with the concept of parameterized tests are familiar with parameterized tests with C#/xUnit TL/DR type Somebody = { Name : string } let samplesTLDR : obj[] list = [ [| { Name = "Homer" }; "Homer" |] [| { Name = "Marge" }; "Marge" |] ] [<Theory>] [<MemberData(nameof(samplesTLDR))>] let ``test TLDR`` someBody expected = Assert.

item.title: F# Test Setup for FizzBuzz
item.description: In my previous post we setup a basic F# project in Linux. In this post I would like to show how to setup an idiomatic F# testing environment using FsUnit.

item.title: F# Setup Linux: FizzBuzz
item.description: One of the first things I always struggle with when learning new languages is the environment. Here is a simple setup for playing with F# and Linux. Prerequisite: .NET Core with Linux I won’t go into setting up .
